plot: Finding Counterfactual Explanations through Constraint Relaxations
summary: Interactive constraint systems often suffer from infeasibility (no solution) due to conflicting user constraints. A counterfactual explanation is a type of explanation that can provide a basis for the user to recover feasibility by helping them understand which changes can be applied to their existing constraints rather than removing them. This approach has been extensively studied in the machine learning field, but requires a more thorough investigation in the context of constraint satisfaction. They propose an iterative method based on conflict detection and maximal relaxations in over-constrained constraint satisfaction problems.
